channel.title: Project Oraculum [Hyperion]
channel.description:
[ul][list][list]Hello, and welcome to the official Oraculum Development thread. Here you can keep track of all current updates I have made to Oraculum, and track the progress of the source that will hopefully unify the MoparScape Community.
[size=18pt]Key Features[/size] [list] [li][b]NO[/b] customs. Period. most people add customs because they think that it will be a nice addition, but really it just makes the server look sloppy because no content was developed with the customs.[/li] [li]Hyperion is the base. now I know I'll probably be flamed because of this, but Hyperion was really effective, but there can still be some improvements. Like making sure that not EVERYTHING is it's own object, when it can easily be substituted for an int for example.[/li] [li]Everything will be stored in a Database. Note that this might not be as fast as a local file, but it is more efficient. And I personally value efficiency over speed.[/li] [/list]
[size=18pt]Planned Developments[/size]
This is where I will keep the features I intend to add to the server. [list] [li]Personal Shops. In lieu of a Grand Exchange that is almost always programmed improperly and ineffectively, I will be giving players a secondary storage container that they can either store items in for more transport(Like a Yak in Summoning), but they will also have the option of setting a price for the items in this container, and other Players can view their shop and purchase the items that way.[/li] [li]Full Skills. Not just dinky half-assed cutting bows and arrows. I'm talking about 100% content. Every frame correct, every option used, every piece of this server programmed to it's fullest potential.[/li] [li]All Minigames. Yes [b]EVERY[/b] Minigame. Ranging from Castlewars and Barrows, to Runeversi and Runedoku(The sudoku spinoff used with Ali Morisanne for (generally) cheaper runes).[/li] [li]All Original Quests. Yes, this will take an extensive amount of time, and require me to complete each quest in RuneScape to get all the fine details, but it will be worth it to the players[/li] [li]And much, much more.[/li] [/list]
[size=18pt]Bugs[/size] [list] [li]Items classified as full helms show the beard, where hats don't. Status: Completed[/li][/list]
[size=18pt]Updates[/size] [list] [li]April 10th: Removed the ugly configuration loading created by Graham, and replaced it with a clean loading from a DB.[/li] [li]April 14th: Decided to roll a 474. Make something worthwhile.[/li] [/list] [size=18pt]Media[/size] I haven't taken any pictures yet, but I will be soon.
So check back here often to stay up-to-date on Oraculum. Thank you for reading.[/list][/list][/ul]

item.title: Project Oraculum [Hyperion]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

UPDATE: Decided that since all 474’s to date are in very poor shape, Oraculum will be the leading force in what 474’s SHOULD have been. Same goals, all skills, etc, but with all that extra 474 content.

Read full topic

item.title: Project Oraculum [Hyperion]
item.dc:creator: @_bool
item.description:
@_bool wrote:

So it would like convert the new engine models into a model render able on the old engine?
If so I don’t quite understand the point, if people don’t like the new HD graphics can’t they use SD and it would look like the older look(I don’t remember as I haven’t played RS in a while.)

Read full topic

item.title: Project Oraculum [Hyperion]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote="(Anthony), post:14, topic:336414"][quote author=zyle1992 link=topic=432784.msg3178783#msg3178783 date=1271113489]

[ul][li]Multi-Client Support. I know that some people prefer the graphics of the 508 over the graphics of the 317, and so I will add Multi Client support. That way, you’ll have the same content, and whatever extra features you may desire ;)[/li][/ul]

goodluck with this, im interested in how you do this, multi client support is a pain in the ass. I just hope you know what your getting into.

Pretty simple if you use separate packet encoder/decoders for each client revision. Also you’d need a different ActionSender for each revision too.

But you also have to take into account the different items, different maps, different monsters, etc.

Make use of the JAGGRAB server and my cache converter

That has nothing to do with what I’m talking about.
Your server has to take into account there are different items, etc.

Client receives an update packet with numbers outside it’s bounds, it requests the data in a way similar to the JAGGRAB server, the server converts the data from the cache from the appropriate revision sends that info back using the OnDemand system(or a subtle variation) and packs that data into the clients cache.
[/quote]
I’m confused at how you want the old engine to render the new engines models.[/quote]

convert the data with the help of MrPotatoHead

Read full topic

item.title: Project Oraculum [Hyperion]
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[ul][list][list]Hello, and welcome to the official Oraculum Development thread. Here you can keep track of all current updates I have made to Oraculum, and track the progress of the source that will hopefully unify the MoparScape Community.

[size=18pt]Key Features[/size]
[list]
[li]NO customs. Period. most people add customs because they think that it will be a nice addition, but really it just makes the server look sloppy because no content was developed with the customs.[/li]
[li]Hyperion is the base. now I know I’ll probably be flamed because of this, but Hyperion was really effective, but there can still be some improvements. Like making sure that not EVERYTHING is it’s own object, when it can easily be substituted for an int for example.[/li]
[li]Everything will be stored in a Database. Note that this might not be as fast as a local file, but it is more efficient. And I personally value efficiency over speed.[/li]
[/list]

[size=18pt]Planned Developments[/size]

This is where I will keep the features I intend to add to the server.
[list]
[li]Personal Shops. In lieu of a Grand Exchange that is almost always programmed improperly and ineffectively, I will be giving players a secondary storage container that they can either store items in for more transport(Like a Yak in Summoning), but they will also have the option of setting a price for the items in this container, and other Players can view their shop and purchase the items that way.[/li]
[li]Full Skills. Not just dinky half-assed cutting bows and arrows. I’m talking about 100% content. Every frame correct, every option used, every piece of this server programmed to it’s fullest potential.[/li]
[li]All Minigames. Yes EVERY Minigame. Ranging from Castlewars and Barrows, to Runeversi and Runedoku(The sudoku spinoff used with Ali Morisanne for (generally) cheaper runes).[/li]
[li]All Original Quests. Yes, this will take an extensive amount of time, and require me to complete each quest in RuneScape to get all the fine details, but it will be worth it to the players[/li]
[li]And much, much more.[/li]
[/list]

[size=18pt]Bugs[/size]
[list]
[li]Items classified as full helms show the beard, where hats don’t. Status: Completed[/li][/list]

[size=18pt]Updates[/size]
[list]
[li]April 10th: Removed the ugly configuration loading created by Graham, and replaced it with a clean loading from a DB.[/li]
[li]April 14th: Decided to roll a 474. Make something worthwhile.[/li]
[/list]
[size=18pt]Media[/size]
I haven’t taken any pictures yet, but I will be soon.

So check back here often to stay up-to-date on Oraculum. Thank you for reading.[/list][/list][/ul]

Read full topic
